reviews.review_msg: Great class design (Book/GIT/Slides/Assignments). Focus on understanding how to interpret and use statistical learning. Brad covered more material than any prof I've ever had. Tests were hard but fair. He always took questions and tried to explain anything with which someone was confused. Shame only 20% of the class actually showed up to lecture.
Posts full lecture notes and recorded lectures. Good explanations and clearly lays out expectations for exams.

Some of the best stats lectures I've had. He tries to make concepts intuitive with analogies and visual drawings. He held multiple sessions outside of class with his TA so students could ask questions. There were a couple of projects where you got to apply what you've learned.

Dr. Shi is respectful, caring, accommodating, and knowledgeable. He provides all the class material, including recorded lectures, practice HW problems, and all the coding details, which makes it very easy to study for the class. He goes over the concepts in detail while not making it challenging. I recommend taking this class with him if you can.

Stat342 is a high level coding course, but the it is easy to learn. Prof. Shi is very knowledgable and accessible. Sometimes he try to build the connection between SAS and R in lecture. And he is friendly when students ask any questions. And I really like the final project he assigned. I learned a lot from this course. Highly recommend!

He is friendly and approachable. His accent is rather strong. He always stutters in class which makes it harder to understand his material, especially when he tries to explain mathematical stuff. Changed the assignments and project deadlines multiple times, and didn't let students have the chance to get higher grades if they messed up the exam.

This prof is very caring and knowledgeable. He is new teaching this class during my semester, so there were a few hiccups. But man this course is TOUGH. You are expected to learn both heavy material and the learning curve for the R codes are steep. Way too much for a 3 credit course. If the workload could be cut down, this class would be amazing.

I learned so much about data modelling and machine learning as well as the general goal of predicting with data and understanding error. Owen did an amazing job at helping the class understand these very difficult concepts. With that said, be prepared to study hard at times. Some concepts are not intuitive to learn.

Dr. Ward is willing to help with your assignments and course materials. He explains things very clear. The only bad thing is that he doesn't post the filled notes on Canvas, which requires you to go to the lecture if you want a good grade. The sample final will help you a lot. if you are well prepared, no surprises will be on the exam.
